@title ERC20 interface
@dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20
nodes.name: IERC20

nodes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Unsigned math operations with safety checks that revert on error
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two unsigned integers truncating the quotient, reverts on division by zero.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@dev Divides two unsigned integers and returns the remainder (unsigned integer modulo),
reverts when dividing by zero.
nodes.name: mod
SafeERC20

@title Math
@dev Assorted math operations
nodes.name: Math

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the largest of two numbers.
nodes.name: max

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the smallest of two numbers.
nodes.name: min
average
ReentrancyGuard

nodes.documentation:
@dev Prevents a contract from calling itself, directly or indirectly.
Calling a `nonReentrant` function from another `nonReentrant`
function is not supported. It is possible to prevent this from happening
by making the `nonReentrant` function external, and make it call a
`private` function that does the actual work.
nodes.name: nonReentrant

nodes.documentation:
@title Crowdsale
@dev Crowdsale is a base contract for managing a token crowdsale,
allowing investors to purchase tokens with ether. This contract implements
such functionality in its most fundamental form and can be extended to provide additional
functionality and/or custom behavior.
The external interface represents the basic interface for purchasing tokens, and conform
the base architecture for crowdsales. They are *not* intended to be modified / overridden.
The internal interface conforms the extensible and modifiable surface of crowdsales. Override
the methods to add functionality. Consider using 'super' where appropriate to concatenate
behavior.
nodes.name: Crowdsale
TokensPurchased

nodes.documentation:
@dev fallback function ***DO NOT OVERRIDE***
Note that other contracts will transfer fund with a base gas stipend
of 2300, which is not enough to call buyTokens. Consider calling
buyTokens directly when purchasing tokens from a contract.
@return the token being sold.
nodes.name: token

nodes.documentation: @return the address where funds are collected.
nodes.name: wallet

nodes.documentation: @return the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.
nodes.name: rate

nodes.documentation: @return the amount of wei raised.
nodes.name: weiRaised
buyTokens
_preValidatePurchase
_postValidatePurchase
_deliverTokens
_processPurchase
_updatePurchasingState
_getTokenAmount

nodes.documentation: @dev Determines how ETH is stored/forwarded on purchases.
nodes.name: _forwardFunds

nodes.documentation:
@title AllowanceCrowdsale
@dev Extension of Crowdsale where tokens are held by a wallet, which approves an allowance to the crowdsale.
nodes.name: AllowanceCrowdsale

nodes.documentation:
@dev Constructor, takes token wallet address.
@param tokenWallet Address holding the tokens, which has approved allowance to the crowdsale
@return the address of the wallet that will hold the tokens.
nodes.name: tokenWallet

nodes.documentation:
@dev Checks the amount of tokens left in the allowance.
@return Amount of tokens left in the allowance
nodes.name: remainingTokens
_deliverTokens
StandardCrowdsale

nodes.documentation: @dev Calls Crowdsale and AllowanceCrowdsale constructors

Calling a `nonReentrant` function from another `nonReentrant`
function is not supported. It is possible to prevent this from happening
by making the `nonReentrant` function external, and make it call a

nodes.documentation:
@title Crowdsale
@dev Crowdsale is a base contract for managing a token crowdsale,
allowing investors to purchase tokens with ether. This contract implements
such functionality in its most fundamental form and can be extended to provide additional
functionality and/or custom behavior.
The external interface represents the basic interface for purchasing tokens, and conform
the base architecture for crowdsales. They are *not* intended to be modified / overridden.
The internal interface conforms the extensible and modifiable surface of crowdsales. Override
the methods to add functionality. Consider using 'super' where appropriate to concatenate
behavior.
nodes.name: Crowdsale

Note that other contracts will transfer fund with a base gas stipend
of 2300, which is not enough to call buyTokens. Consider calling

@return the token being sold.

StandardCrowdsale

nodes.documentation: @dev Calls Crowdsale and AllowanceCrowdsale constructors

buyTokens(address).details: low level token purchase ***DO NOT OVERRIDE*** This function has a non-reentrancy guard, so it shouldn't be called by another `nonReentrant` function.

rate().return: the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.

remainingTokens().details: Checks the amount of tokens left in the allowance.
remainingTokens().return: Amount of tokens left in the allowance

tokenWallet().return: the address of the wallet that will hold the tokens.

wallet().return: the address where funds are collected.

devdoc.title: StandardCrowdsale Extends Crowdsale and AllowanceCrowdsale. Calls their constructors. No additional functionality.
